title: AWGR-based All-to-all Optical Interconnects using Limited Number of Wavelengths
name: AWGR-based All-to-all Optical Interconnects using Limited Number of Wavelengths Published paper-conference 2013-05-01 Yin Y. Yoo S. et al. 2013 Optical Interconnects Conference 2376-8665 10.1109oic.2013.6552916
abstract: This paper discusses all-to-all interconnections for N nodes using W wavelengths and arrayed waveguide grating routers AWGRs. This scheme allows for reducing the optical wiring by a factor of WN-l2N and isolating the crosstalk. 2013 IEEE.

title: The all pervading nanosensors
name: The all pervading nanosensors Published article-journal 2008 Islam M. International Journal of Nanotechnology 1741-8151 10.1504ijnt.2008.017445
abstract: Nanosensors are central to many exciting developments in nanotechnology research. Following more than a decade of research the applications of nanoscale sensors are progressively becoming a technological issue more than a field of fundamental research. With a sharp rise of attention in the past 15 years on self-organised zero or one dimensional nanostructures based on synthetic bottom-up techniques researchers have proposed and demonstrated innovative nanosensors that could not have been realised through the transformative top-down techniques. Several recently reported massively parallel bottom-up techniques offer the potential for high-density integration of nanosensors beyond the capability of conventional technologies with a small fraction of the present-day fabrication cost. A tremendous synergy can be attained by integrating nanosensors based on plasmonics electronics photonics and conventional sensors on the same chip and exploiting the advantages of each technology. This special issue offers a timely overview of the nanosensor field and covers the latest developments on various self-organised nano-structures special structural characterisation physical properties current trends and future directions in nanoscale sensors their devices and circuit integration. Copyright 2008 Inderscience Enterprises Ltd.

title: HALL A Hierarchical All-to-All Optical Interconnect Architecture
name: HALL A Hierarchical All-to-All Optical Interconnect Architecture Published paper-conference 2014-05-01 Cao Z. Yoo S. et al. 2014 IEEE Optical Interconnects Conference OI 2014 2376-8665 10.1109oic.2014.6886085
abstract: We propose a hierarchical all-to-all optical interconnection architecture that implements packet switching by tightly coupling optical and electrical switches. Single diameter interconnection scales beyond 500000 nodes and nearly 100 normalized throughput can be achieved. 2014 IEEE.

title: Where are all the genes
name: Where are all the genes Published article-journal 2002-08 Schank J. Behavioral and Brain Sciences 1469-1825 10.1017s0140525x02460098
abstract: Andrews et al. argue for adaptationism in cognitive research. However the problem of evolvability brings into question the number of genes required for the evolution of cognitive mechanisms. Are there enough Also greater consideration should be given to alternative vicarious selection processes which may produce cognitive mechanisms. Finally identifying constraints with optimality arguments is more difficult than the authors think.

title: Tying it all together
name: Tying it all together Published chapter 2013-10-02 Watkins K. Best Practices for Transportation Agency Use of Social Media 10.1201b15768

title: Immune from It All
name: Immune from It All Published article-journal 2012-09-05 Zeki A. Science Translational Medicine 1946-6242 10.1126scitranslmed.3004843
abstract: jatspWhat our lungs can learn from our guts about mitigating bacterial infections.jatsp

title: FlexLION A Reconfigurable All-to-All Optical Interconnect Fabric with Bandwidth Steering
name: FlexLION A Reconfigurable All-to-All Optical Interconnect Fabric with Bandwidth Steering Published paper-conference 2019-01-01 Proietti R. Yoo S. et al. Optics InfoBase Conference Papers 2162-2701 10.1364cleo_si.2019.sm3g.2
abstract: We demonstrate an all-to-all interconnect fabric with bandwidth steering by wavelength routing wavelength adddrop filtering and spatial switching. We report a proof-of-concept experiment and demonstrate scalability up to 32 ports with aggregated bandwidth of 51.2 Tbs under worst-case crosstalk.

title: All Together Now
name: All Together Now Published article-journal 2015-07 Kratz H. Mandell D. et al. Journal of Psychoeducational Assessment 1557-5144 10.11770734282914554853
abstract: This study sought to validate a new measure the Classroom Cohesion Survey CCS designed to examine the relationship between teachers and classroom assistants in autism support classrooms. Teachers classroom assistants and external observers showed good inter-rater agreement on the CCS and good internal consistency for all scales. Simple factor structures were found for both teacher- and classroom assistant-rated scales with one-factor solutions for both scales. Paired t tests revealed that on average classroom assistants rated classroom cohesion stronger than teachers. The CCS may be an effective tool for measuring cohesion between classroom staff and may have an important impact on various clinical and implementation outcomes in school settings.

title: All That You Touch
